chapter:
Data and adminsitrative consoles
This chapter provides a reference of Tarantool data operations and administrative commands.
Unlike many traditional data servers, Tarantool uses different TCP ports and client/server protocol for data operations and administrative operations. On start up, the server connects to three TCP ports:
read/write data port, to handle INSERTs, UPDATEs, DELETEs and SELECTs; the default value of the port is 33015,
read only port, that only accepts SELECTs 33015,
The data protocol is binary; a complete description is provided in doc/box-protocol.txt.
administrative port, which defaults to /write data port, to handle INSERTs, UPDATEs, DELETEs and SELECTs; the default value of the port is 33015,
read only port, that only accepts SELECTs 33015,
separation of ports is done in part to allow system administrators to secure the read/write port or the administrative port. The values of read-only, read-write and administrative ports can be specified in the configuration file.
